headlines: Recyclers Cringe as Southeast Asia Says It’s Sick of the West’s Trash
summaries: After China restricted plastic scrap imports, countries like Malaysia took the brunt of the waste. But now there’s a regionwide backlash, and recyclers are worried.

headlines: France to End Disposal of $900 Million in Unsold Goods Each Year
summaries: The government plans to outlaw the destruction of brand-new consumer products, a practice that companies use to stop goods from being stolen or sold at steep discounts.

headlines: Carnival Cruises to Pay $20 Million in Pollution and Cover-Up Case
summaries: In 2016, Princess Cruise Lines agreed to pay $40 million for illegal dumping. But that didn’t stop Carnival, its parent company, from polluting again.

headlines: Those Tiny Hotel Toiletry Bottles Are on Their Way Out
summaries: A bill in California would force hotels to get rid of single-use shampoo and soap bottles to keep plastic waste down.

headlines: Food Delivery Apps Are Drowning China in Plastic
summaries: The noodles and barbecue arrive within 30 minutes. The containers they come in could be around for hundreds of years thereafter.

headlines: Canada Agrees to Take Back Trash Sent to Philippines Years Ago
summaries: The garbage, which was mistakenly shipped to the Philippines in 2013 and 2014, had been the subject of a diplomatic dispute and outrage from President Rodrigo Duterte.

headlines: Philippines Recalls Its Ambassador to Canada in a Spat Over Trash
summaries: The recall comes after Canada failed to take back tons of household rubbish sent to the Southeast Asian country that had been labeled as recyclable.

headlines: Waste Not, if You Want to Help Secure the Future of the Planet
summaries: Companies are experimenting with new definitions of waste and new ways of disposing of it — or avoiding the creation of it altogether

headlines: Electronic Marvels Turn Into Dangerous Trash in East Africa
summaries: Companies seek solutions to the unintended consequences of rising wealth that allows for more electronics — and the e-waste that inevitably comes next.

headlines: Philippines Sets Deadline for Canada to Take Back Trash
summaries: President Rodrigo Duterte demanded that tons of garbage mistakenly sent to his country be returned by May 15, threatening otherwise to dump it on Canada’s shore.

headlines: Capri Welcomes 2.3 Million Tourists a Year but Wants to Limit the Trash They Leave Behind
summaries: Capri has decreed a ban on plastic and would like to limit boat traffic, too, in an effort to control those twin Italian ills: tourism and trash.

headlines: Seaweed Pods, Anyone? Marathons Get Creative to Stop Littering the Streets
summaries: Plastic bottles and cups fill the streets after marathons. But a more pressing problem from these events is something you can’t see: Your carbon footprint.

headlines: After Duterte’s Threats Over Tons of Old Trash, Canada Says It’s Working on It
summaries: President Rodrigo Duterte of the Philippines said he was ready to “declare war” with Canada over hundreds of tons of waste shipped to his country over five years ago.

headlines: Paper or Plastic? Time to Bring Your Own Bag
summaries: The City Council has approved a 5-cent charge on paper bags, making it harder to hide from the statewide ban on single-use plastic ones.

headlines: Hello, Little Microbe. Doesn’t This Jacket Look Yummy?
summaries: Now we can trick tiny bugs into eating our clothing. Consumption is finally a good thing.

headlines: Tackling the Plastic Problem, One City (or Country) at a Time
summaries: For Earth Day, a look at what three traveler-friendly locations are doing to reduce their plastic waste.

headlines: How to Travel Without Leaving a Trace
summaries: In time for Earth Day, items that tourist destinations often find tossed out by travelers — and some ways that you can avoid adding to all that rubbish.

headlines: How to Break Your Single-Use Plastics Habit
summaries: Ditch your one-and-done straws, spoons, and containers with this kit of affordable, reusable stand-ins.

headlines: When Trash Is a Journalist’s Treasure
summaries: Jake Orta was not aware he was searching the bins of Mark Zuckerberg’s house until we told him who owned the place.

headlines: In San Francisco, Making a Living From Your Billionaire Neighbor’s Trash
summaries: In a city swollen by the wealth of the tech industry, the rich and poor live very separate lives. But sometimes they connect through the garbage.

headlines: 88 Pounds of Trash Found in Whale’s Stomach
summaries: In a city swollen by the wealth of the tech industry, the rich and poor live very separate lives. But sometimes they connect through the garbage.

headlines: ‘Monster of a Fatberg’ Discovered In English Sewer
summaries: In a city swollen by the wealth of the tech industry, the rich and poor live very separate lives. But sometimes they connect through the garbage.

headlines: Dead Whale’s Stomach Is Found Filled With Trash in Indonesia
summaries: In a city swollen by the wealth of the tech industry, the rich and poor live very separate lives. But sometimes they connect through the garbage.
